intro: Ptelea ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the United States. It is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves, which are typically dark green and have a smooth texture. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in the spring, which are followed by red or orange berries in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry woodlands and rocky slopes. The botanical features of Ptelea ovata make it an important component of native plant communities in its native range.
